content: The move, first reported by the New York Times and confirmed by two Biden advisers, appeared designed to calm donors and skittish supporters, but it was unclear how much it would actually change the internal operations. Dunn has been heavily involved in the c… [+1256 chars]
source.name: The Washington Post

author: Matt McClain
title: 50 town halls, 3 weeks, 1 outfit: Pete Buttigieg’s race to the top
description: Former South Bend, Ind., mayor Pete Buttigieg hustled around Iowa before the caucuses, holding more than 50 town halls in a frantic three-week period. Buttigieg wore the same outfit every day during his final Iowa push — a white shirt, blue tie and navy blue …
content:
When a voter asked about his uniform, Buttigieg said he makes decisions all day and enjoys having to make one fewer choice each morning.
His campaign focused on districts that voted for Donald Trump in the 2016 general election, pitching Buttigieg as someone… [+952 chars]
source.name: The Washington Post

author: Christian Davenport
title: NASA says Boeing Starliner space capsule has widespread software problems
description: Boeing is now reviewing all 1 million lines of code in the capsule’s computer systems, officials said. How long that review will take is uncertain.
content: The discovery of widespread software problems in the Starliner spacecraft is reminiscent of the issues that surfaced in the aftermath of the crashes of two Boeing 737 Max airplanes that killed 346 people and led to the planes grounding since early last year. … [+6010 chars]
source.name: The Washington Post

title: Bolton reviewing letter from White House about manuscript

author: Philip Bump
title: Trump hasn’t offered any reason beyond the obvious for punishing Alexander Vindman
description: Instead, we’re encouraged to assume that the obvious is the case.
content: That response suggests that Trumps frustration with Vindman which, in fact, led to his removal from the White House on Friday afternoon stems from obvious causes. In fact, Trumps never offered any concrete rationale for ousting Vindman. While this mirrors the… [+6743 chars]

author: Drew Harwell
title: Trump shared an edited Pelosi video on social media, highlighting a gray area in the debate over disinformation
description: A video tweeted by President Trump of House Speaker Nancy Pelosi was not a sophisticated « deepfake » or an intricately altered « cheapfake. » The events actually happened, just not in that order. So what should the tech giants and civil society do when video…
content: The debate over the video highlights an immense gray area when it comes to moderating posts, photos and videos on social media, especially when theyre shared by users with large followings, many of whose followers might believe the clip was an authentic retel… [+6440 chars]

author: David Weigel
title: The stage is set. Will there be zingers?
description: In this edition: What to watch for in tonight’s debate, the tourists crowding New Hampshire town halls, and the billionaires’ latest ads.

author: Ian Livingston
title: PM Update: Winds slowly diminish tonight ahead of a fairly comfortable weekend
description: There's mostly smooth sailing ahead, once we get past this wind.

author: John Hopewell, Jason Samenow
title: Despite the warmth and rain, there’s still some good skiing in the Mid-Atlantic
description: Don’t let the tornadoes in the area Friday discourage you from hitting the slopes this weekend.
content:
Dont let the tornadoes in the area Friday discourage you from hitting the slopes this weekend. Behind the thunderstorms it is currently dumping snow in the high country from Seven Springs, Pa., down the Allegheny Front to Snowshoe, W.Va.
